94 Headquarters introduced a letter from Irving R. MeniU of the
Research Committee to the Board of Directors explaining a Research Committee
recommendation that NAEB purchase ”NCS #2”, a nation-wide radio and
television coverage study as conducted in the spring of 1956 by the Nielsen
Company of Chciago. Details of such a purchase were described in the
recommendation * The Board reviewed the pros and cons of such a proposal
including value received, the need fear such information, possible uses, and
reactions of Association members. Since reactions to the proposal varied so
greatly, it was not approved and the consensus was the the Board needed
additional advice, Accordingly, Schooley moved that tsoadquaitars get reactions
from a representative group of at least five radio and/or television station
managers, inviting them to study the proposal and made recommendations.
Headquarters will then collate this material for action by the Board. Schenkkan
seconded and approval granted with Bronson recorded as dissenting.”
I have j ust today received this material from Irving Merrill, and am
sending out at once. >
Would you therefore, as soon as you can, provide the recommendations
requested ?
Since the action called for its sending to ” at least five” in both
radio and TV I hope the selection, a combination of suggestions of Merrill
(for 4) and mine (for 3) will be satisfactory.
